description: Variation of condition 2 (Approved drawings) attached to planning permission ref 2016/1963 dated 07/12/2018 for the redevelopment of existing site (including demolition of existing building) to build a 3-storey (plus basement) synagogue (Class D1) including associated hard and soft landscaping to the front of the building.
decision_conditions:
<p>There shall be no more than 300 visitors into the premises hereby approved at any one
time.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use does not lead to a loss of amenity for nearby
residents and to ensure that no negative highway impacts arise as a result of
the development.</p>

<p>The proposed development shall be used as a Synagogue only and for no
other use within Use Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country
Planning (Use Classes Order) 1987, as amended.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use does not lead to a loss of amenity for nearby
residents and to ensure that no negative highway impacts arise as a result of
the development.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the Construction Management Plan as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/1175.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development does not lead to a loss of amenity for nearby residents and to ensure that no negative highway impacts arise as a result of the development.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the Lighting Strategy as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/1598 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To ensure that the development does not lead to a loss of amenity for nearby
residents.</p>

<p>Details of refuse enclosures, including facilities for the storage of
materials for recycling, showing the design, location and external appearance,
shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing,
before occupation of the premises. The development shall not be carried out
otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: In order to provide for adequate bin enclosures in the interest of the
appearance of the site and area.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the investigative work and remedial action plan as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/2200 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To ensure that potential contamination risks are identified and
suitable remediation is agreed.</p>

<p>Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved, an Operational Management Plan including details of servicing, waste
management and measures to prevent undue noise disturbance to
surrounding residential occupiers shall be submitted to and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan and details.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring owner/occupiers and to
ensure that the proposal is acceptable in terms of Highways impacts.<br></p>

<p><b>Prior to the further excavation of the basement hereby approved,</b>&nbsp;precise details of groundwater flood mitigation measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The measures should include suitable measures against
the effects of groundwater be incorporated in construction methods and design of basement structure. Consideration
should also be given to how the retained material is drained in the basement. Suitable protection measures should be
provided against the flooding of the (temporary) construction works and design of suitable surface water drainage
systems to ensure the basement is protected from surface water flooding.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the basement development has an acceptable impact on ground conditions and minimises the risk of flooding.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall
be fixed to the street elevations of the building, unless otherwise agreed in
writing by the Local Planning Authority.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is
satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the
area.<br></p>

<p>No roof plant (including all external enclosures, machinery and other
installations) other than that shown on the approved drawings shall be placed
upon or attached to the roof or other external surfaces of the building.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is
satisfac<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the detailed drawings and full particulars as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/4081 and thereafter maintained for the lifetime of the development.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the BREEAM assessment and energy strategy as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/4081 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed sustainability measures are implemented to a satisfactory standard as proposed.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the material schedule as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/4081 and thereafter maintained for the lifetime of the development.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development the applicant is to submit the
following in writing to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority:
</p><p>1) Full BREEAM post construction certification confirming that the
development has achieved a BREEAM Very Good rating, with a minimum
score of 65 points.
</p><p>2) Commissioning certificates, carried out by an MCS certified renewable
energy installer, confirming the installed capacity of the proposed renewable
energy technologies.
</p><p>3) Specification details of all major cooling and heating plant, and confirmation
that the installed plant are registered on the Governments Energy Technology
List.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed sustainability measures are
implemented to a satisfactory standard as proposed.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be carried out in strict accordance with the biodiverse living roof details as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/4081 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to
provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban
drainage, and to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed
building.</p>

<p>The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used for any
purpose other than as a means of escape in emergency or for maintenance of
the building. In particular the roof shall not be used as a roof terrace, balcony
or any other amenity area.
</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining premises
and the area generally.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the Noise Assessment and Noise Management Plan as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/1175 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining premises and the area generally.</p>

<p>The use hereby approved is permitted to operate outside the hours
specified above in condition 14 on up to eight days in the first calendar year of
the operation subject to the proposed extended hours being approved by the
Local Planning Authority at least 10 days in advance of the event taking place.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use is operated in a satisfactory manner and
does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity
generally.<br></p>

<p>The portions of the building hereby permitted which have been set aside
for study accommodation/Mikvah shall not be used other than as ancillary to
the synagogue use of the same building and shall not be occupied or used
separately to the said main use.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use does not lead to a loss of amenity for nearby
residents and to ensure that no negative highway impacts arise as a result of
the development.<br></p>

<p>Before occupation/use of the development a post-development verification
report will be produced to the satisfaction of and approved in writing by the
Planning Authority. The verification report must fully set out any restrictions
on the future use of a development and demonstrate that arrangements have
been made to inform future site users of the restrictions. Work shall be
completed and reporting produced by a competent person/company in line
with current best practice guidance, including the Council’s contaminated land
planning guidance. The Contaminated Land Officer must receive verbal and
written notification at least five days before development and remedial works
commence. Subject to written approval by the Planning Authority, this
condition may be varied, or discharged in agreed phases. Any additional, or
unforeseen contamination encountered during the course of development
shall be immediately notified to the Planning Authority and Contaminated Land
Officer.
All development shall cease in the affected area. Any additional or unforeseen
contamination shall be dealt with as agreed with the Contaminated Land
Officer. Where development has ceased in the affected area, it shall
recommence upon written notification of the Planning Authority or
Contaminated Land Officer.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that potential contamination risks are identified and
suitable remediation is agreed.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the Air Quality Assessment as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/1598 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To ensure satisfactory measures are in place to safeguard against
air quality impacts.</p>

<p>The total noise level from fixed plants (external or internal) shall not cause
adverse or significant adverse impact onto the nearest residential premises at
any time. Therefore the rating noise level (specific sound corrected for any
acoustic features) of the plant should be 5dB(A) below the representative
background noise level (L90) at 1 metre from the nearest noise sensitive
receptor. The method of assessment shall be carried out in accordance with
BS4142:2014 ‘Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial
sound’. After all mechanical plants and equipment have been fully installed in
place, and before the premises is occupied, a test shall be carried out to show
above criterion shall be met and the results submitted to the Community
Safety Team for approval.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that occupiers of residential premises do not suffer a loss
of amenity by reason of noise nuisance from equipment.<br></p>

<p>Prior to occupation, a Travel Plan shall have been submitted to
and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Travel Plan shall then be
implemented in accordance with a timetable of implementation, monitoring
and review to be agreed in writing by the Local Planning
Authority.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the travel arrangements to the proposed use are
appropriate and successfully limit the effects of the increase in travel
movements.<br></p>

<p>Details of bird and bat boxes to be implemented as part of the
development, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local
planning authority, prior to the occupation of the development hereby
approved.
</p><p>REASON: To provide potential habitats for local wildlife, in line with the
recommendations of the submitted habitat survey.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the hard and soft landscaping scheme as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2019/2200 and thereafter maintained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;To enhance the character, appearance and ecology of the
development and contribution to green infrastructure.</p>

<p>Except on days of collection, all refuse and waste shall be stored in sealed
containers in the approved refuse storage areas.
</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the appearance of the street and the amenity of
adjoining occupiers.<br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the Piling Method Statement as submitted and approved under Discharge of Condition application ref: 2021/2832.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp;The proposed works will be in close proximity to underground
sewerage utility infrastructure. Piling has the potential to impact on local
underground sewerage utility infrastructure. The applicant is advised to
contact Thames Water Developer Services on 0800 009 3921 to discuss the
details of the piling method statement.</p>

<p>The perforated metal mesh screen hereby approved shall be implemented
prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved and retained in
perpetuity thereafter.
</p><p>REASON: To prevent and mitigate overlooking to nearby residential occupiers.<br></p>

<p><b>Prior to the further excavation of the basement as hereby approved, </b>detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where
applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention
planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be
submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway
rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It
must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall
reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p>REASON: To ensure the basement development has an acceptable impact on ground conditions and minimises the risk of flooding.</p>
